name: Butter Chicken
description: A classic, creamy and indulgent curry that brings the authentic taste of North Indian restaurants to your kitchen. Rich tomato-based sauce with tender chicken pieces.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with yogurt, half the garam masala, salt for 30 minutes
Heat oil in a large pan and cook marinated chicken until golden. Remove and set aside
In the same pan, saut√© finely chopped onions until golden brown
Add minced garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add remaining spices and cook for 30 seconds
Pour in tomato passata and simmer for 10 minutes until thickened
Return chicken to the pan, add cream and simmer for 5 minutes
Serve hot with basmati rice and fresh coriander

name: Palak Paneer
description: Creamy spinach curry with soft paneer cubes - a beloved vegetarian classic that's both nutritious and incredibly satisfying. Perfect comfort food that's packed with iron and protein.
instructions: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, drain and blend to smooth paste
Cut paneer into cubes and lightly fry until golden. Set aside
Heat oil and add cumin seeds until they splutter
Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chillies, cook for 1 minute
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and pulpy
Add turmeric and garam masala, cook for 30 seconds
Add spinach puree and simmer for 10 minutes
Gently fold in paneer cubes and cream, simmer for 3 minutes
Serve hot with naan or rice

name: Dal Makhani
description: The king of lentil curries - slow-cooked black lentils in a rich, creamy tomato sauce. This restaurant-style dal is the ultimate comfort food that tastes like a warm hug from home.
instructions: Soak black urad dal and kidney beans overnight
Pressure cook the soaked lentils until very soft and creamy
Heat butter in a heavy-bottomed pan
Add cumin seeds and let them splutter
Add chopped onions and cook until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until completely broken down
Add all spices and cook for 2 minutes
Add the cooked lentils and simmer on low heat for 30 minutes
Stir in cream and simmer for another 10 minutes until thick and creamy
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan

name: Chicken Biryani
description: Aromatic basmati rice layered with spiced chicken - the crown jewel of Indian cuisine. Each grain is infused with saffron and whole spices for an unforgettable feast.
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala and salt for 2 hours
Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes, then boil with whole spices until 70% cooked
Deep fry sliced onions until golden brown and crispy
Cook marinated chicken until 80% done
Soak saffron in warm milk
Layer the partially cooked rice over chicken
Sprinkle fried onions, saffron milk, and ghee on top
Cover with foil and lid, cook on high heat for 3 minutes
Reduce heat to lowest setting and cook for 45 minutes
Let it rest for 10 minutes before opening
Gently mix and serve with raita and boiled eggs

name: Chole Bhature
description: Spicy chickpea curry paired with fluffy deep-fried bread - the ultimate North Indian street food combo that's perfect for weekend indulgence.
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight, then pressure cook until soft
For bhature: mix flour, yogurt, baking powder, salt and knead into soft dough
Rest dough for 2 hours covered with damp cloth
Heat oil in pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and pulpy
Add chole masala and cooked chickpeas with some cooking liquid
Simmer for 15 minutes until thick and flavorful
Roll bhature dough into circles and deep fry until puffed and golden
Serve hot chole with freshly fried bhature and pickled onions

name: Rajma Chawal
description: Comforting red kidney bean curry served over steamed rice - the ultimate Sunday comfort meal that reminds every North Indian of home and mother's cooking.
instructions: Soak rajma overnight, then pressure cook until very soft
Cook basmati rice separately and keep warm
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds
Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until completely soft
Add rajma masala and red chilli powder, cook for 1 minute
Add cooked rajma with cooking liquid
Simmer for 20 minutes until thick and creamy
Mash some beans to thicken the curry
Serve hot over steamed rice with a dollop of ghee

name: Masala Dosa with Sambar
description: Crispy golden crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, filled with spiced potato curry and served with aromatic sambar. The iconic South Indian breakfast that brings memories of Chennai mornings.
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 4-6 hours, then grind into smooth batters
Mix batters with salt and ferment overnight in a warm place
For sambar: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft and mushy
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves until they splutter
Add chopped onions, ginger, and green chillies, saut√© until golden
Add tomatoes and cook until soft, then add sambar powder
Add cooked dal, tamarind paste, and salt, simmer for 15 minutes
For potato filling: boil and cube potatoes, saut√© with onions and spices
Heat non-stick pan, spread dosa batter thin, cook until golden and crispy
Place potato filling on one side, fold dosa and serve hot with sambar

name: Idli with Coconut Sambar
description: Soft, fluffy steamed rice cakes that melt in your mouth, served with coconut-enriched sambar. The ultimate comfort food that reminds every South Indian of home and mother's love.
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 4-6 hours
Grind urad dal to a fluffy white batter, then grind rice to smooth paste
Mix both batters with salt and ferment overnight in warm place
Steam the fermented batter in idli molds for 12-15 minutes
For sambar: pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until very soft
Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves
Add onions and saut√©, then add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add vegetables, sambar powder, and cook for 5 minutes
Add cooked dal, tamarind paste, coconut, and simmer until thick
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with soft idlis

name: Sambar Vada
description: Crispy golden lentil donuts dunked in aromatic sambar - the perfect rainy day comfort food. Each bite combines the crunch of perfectly fried vada with the tangy, spicy sambar.
instructions: Soak urad dal for 3-4 hours, then drain completely
Grind urad dal with minimal water to a thick, fluffy batter
Add chopped green chillies, ginger, and salt to the batter
Heat oil for deep frying to 180¬∞C
Wet hands and shape batter into small donuts with holes in center
Fry vadas until golden brown and crispy, drain on paper towels
For sambar: pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until mushy
Heat 2 tbsp oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves
Add chopped onions and saut√© until translucent
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and pulpy
Add mixed vegetables and cook for 5 minutes
Add sambar powder, cook for 2 minutes until fragrant
Add cooked dal, tamarind paste, salt, and 2 cups water
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender and sambar thickens
Gently place fried vadas in hot sambar and simmer for 2 minutes
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve immediately

name: Rava Upma
description: A wholesome and quick South Indian breakfast made with semolina, vegetables, and aromatic spices. Perfect for busy mornings when you want something nutritious and satisfying.
instructions: Dry roast semolina in a pan until lightly golden and aromatic, set aside
Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan
Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds, let them splutter
Add curry leaves, green chillies, and ginger, saut√© for 30 seconds
Add chopped onions and saut√© until translucent
Add diced vegetables and cook for 3-4 minutes
Add turmeric and mix well
Add 3 cups of hot water gradually while stirring continuously
Add salt and bring to a boil
Slowly add roasted semolina while stirring to avoid lumps
Cook on low heat for 5-7 minutes until water is absorbed
Garnish with fresh coriander and lemon juice
Serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle

name: Coconut Rice
description: Fragrant rice cooked with fresh coconut and aromatic South Indian spices. This temple-style rice dish brings the essence of Kerala and Tamil Nadu to your UK kitchen.
instructions: Cook basmati rice with a pinch of salt until fluffy, set aside to cool
If using fresh coconut, grate it; if using desiccated, rehydrate with warm water
Heat ghee in a large pan
Add cashew nuts and fry until golden, remove and set aside
In the same pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds
When they splutter, add curry leaves, green chillies, and ginger
Add grated coconut and turmeric, saut√© for 2-3 minutes
Add cooked rice and gently mix to coat with coconut mixture
Add salt to taste and mix gently
Garnish with fried cashews and fresh coriander
Serve warm with South Indian pickle or papad
